page.title: 17FOOD AND DRINK
page.content: For breakfast I have cereal most mornings, cornflakes, weetabix or bran and sometimes toast and jam.At weekends when there is no school and no work we sometimes have bacon and egg. My school lunch consists of sandwiches, crisps and an apple and sometimes I get sweets or chocolate. At school we can buy sweets, crisps and biscuits at the tuck shop. At home I like to eat things like baked beans, chips and curry. Sometimes we go to the Chinese take-away. A traditional Sunday dinner is meat with vegetables and Yorkshire puddings with gravy made from the meat juices. Then we have ice-cream or fruit tart and cream or sponge pudding and custard or yoghurt.For drinks I like tea, coffee, orange juice or Coca-Cola and sometimes my Dad gives me a shandy.
